column4: anyone knows some cheap dedicated hardware that can run some opensource NAS?
most NAS run opensource OS
u know any cheap ones?
how big do you want?
Not that big. Just one or 2 disks or so.
how about a 1gb nas?
Of course if it comes cheap with 4 it's also good
http://manchesteritservices.securewebstore.co.uk/Inu_products/INU_ProdDetailsL4.asp?ref=28002971
you need to be specific with storage capacity that you need
ho.. that is expensive. I was hoping for a unit (without disks) for about 50 -150 euro
oic you want a NAS shell with no disks...you never said
can be with disks but disks are about 200 eachright?
You know a website of OS Nasfirmware that has a listing of supported devices or something like that?
its a NAS, they are usually accessed over ftp but check the manufacturer to see if they say Linux support. I know the WD QuickBook cvan be a pain
but I don't know which os 'firmwares' are available. is there a list somewhere?
why do you need firmware for a standalone device?
maybe I am misunderstanding it. I mean the os... I would like to know which 'distributions' are available for which nas devices... (like you have dd-wrt for the linksys wrt54gl)
no idea aboutthat sorry. try http://www.google.com
thx
